common

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides general utility methods for file manipulation, metadata extraction, and string formatting.

    This class includes specialised logic for XMP serialisation, TIFF header detection, and forensic-safe string alignment.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private Utils()
      Prevents direct instantiation.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileExtension

        public static java.lang.String getFileExtension(java.nio.file.Path fpath)
        Returns the extension of the image file name, excluding the dot.

        If the file name does not contain an extension, an empty string is returned.

        Parameters:
        fpath - the file path
        Returns:
        the file extension, for example: "jpg" or "png" etc, or an empty string if none

      • updateFileTimeStamps

        public static void updateFileTimeStamps(java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                                        java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime fileTime)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Updates the creation, last access, and last modified time-stamps of the file.
        Parameters:
        fpath - the path to the file
        fileTime - the new time-stamp to apply to all three attributes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the filesystem attributes cannot be modified

      • repeatPrint

        public static java.lang.String repeatPrint(java.lang.String ch,
                                           int n)
        Generates a string consisting of the specified sequence repeated n times.
        Parameters:
        ch - the string to be repeated
        n - the number of times to repeat the string
        Returns:
        the resulting formatted string, or an empty string if n is less or equal to 0

      • validateBoxBounds

        public static void validateBoxBounds(byte[] data,
                                     int offset,
                                     java.lang.String expectedType)
        Validates a box's boundaries before processing.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array containing the box data
        offset - the starting position of the box within the array
        expectedType - the 4-character string (FourCC) expected at the box header
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the data length is insufficient to read the header
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the actual box type does not match the expectedType

      • calculateShiftTiffHeader

        public static int calculateShiftTiffHeader(byte[] payload)
        Scans a byte payload to identify the starting index of the TIFF Magic Bytes (Byte Order Marks). This is essential for skipping container-specific preambles such as the JPEG 'Exif\0\0' signature.
        Parameters:
        payload - the raw byte array to be scanned
        Returns:
        the zero-based index of the TIFF header, or -1 if no signature is detected

      • findValueSpan

        public static int[] findValueSpan(java.lang.String content,
                                  int tagIdx)
        Locates the value within an XMP tag, handling both attribute-style and element-style serialisation.

        This handles the two primary ways XMP serialises data:

        • Attribute: <xmp:ModifyDate="2011:10:07".../>
        • Element: <xmp:ModifyDate>2011:10:07</xmp:ModifyDate>
        Parameters:
        content - the XML string to scan
        tagIdx - the starting index of the tag name within the content
        Returns:
        an array of two integers: [startIndex, length] or null if the span is invalid

      • alignXmpValueSlot

        public static byte[] alignXmpValueSlot(java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt,
                                       int slotWidth)
        Generates a byte array containing the best-fitting ISO date string to fit a fixed-width XMP slot.

        Falls back from full ISO (with offset) to short ISO (no offset) to date-only. If the date is shorter than the slot, it is padded with ASCII spaces (0x20) to maintain binary alignment within the file.

        Parameters:
        zdt - the timestamp to format
        slotWidth - the exact physical width of the target binary slot in bytes
        Returns:
        a byte array of length defined by slotWidth, or null if cannot be computed

      • printFastDumpXML

        public static java.lang.String printFastDumpXML(java.nio.file.Path imagePath,
                                                byte[] xmpBytes)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        A lightweight formatter to extract XMP from raw bytes, applies basic indentation for readability, and saves the result to a sibling .xml file.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - the path to the original image (used to determine the .xml output path)
        xmpBytes - the raw UTF-8 encoded XMP payload
        Returns:
        the formatted XML string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
